title: Space Force nominee sees growing threats to U.S. satellites from rival powers
summary: Lt. Gen. B. Chance Saltzman testified at a confirmation hearing Sept. 13 to be the next chief of space operations of the U.S. Space Force

title: Starlink Group 4-34 mission to complete SpaceX doubleheader
summary: A SpaceX Falcon 9 Block 5 carrying 54 Starlink satellites is targeted to launch at 10:10 PM EDT on September 13 (02:10 UTC on September 14). This mission will be launching from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.

title: Arianespace and OneWeb reach settlement for suspended launches
summary: Arianespace said Sept. 13 it has reached a settlement deal that could revive a launch services agreement with OneWeb that was suspended following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: NASA Announces Pending Departure of Science Associate Administrator
summary: Dr. Thomas Zurbuchen, associate administrator of NASA’s Science Mission Directorate, will leave the agency at the end of 2022, after six years of dedicated service.

title: China launches Zhongxing-1E military communications satellite
summary: China launched a Long March 7A rocket Tuesday, successfully inserting the Zhongxing-1E satellite into geosynchronous transfer orbit.

title: As summer turns to fall, ULA still waiting for its BE-4 rocket engines
summary: "Why, Mr. Spock, you almost make me believe in miracles."

title: Competition is growing in the space-data-relay sector
summary: Companies reveal plans for optical and RF data relay networks to address growing demand from satellite operators for high-speed data transfer.

title: Speedcast nets first Starlink reseller deal for enterprise and maritime
summary: Remote communications provider Speedcast has become the first company to sign a distribution deal to resell SpaceX’s Starlink broadband services to enterprise and maritime customers.

title: Slingshot Aerospace rolls out free space-traffic control service
summary: Slingshot Aerospace, a space data analytics company, announced Sept. 13 it is offering a free version of its space traffic control software to satellite operators

title: Artemis 1 launch plans slip again
summary: Days after NASA proposed to make its next attempt to launch the Artemis 1 mission on Sept. 23, the agency changed course and pushed back the launch.
